instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ripped vram pads
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has the 216-0809000 GPU. Had typical GPU graphic problem. Replaced with NEW GPU from SEE-IC so no fake but had lines on a section of the screen and noticed piece of glue was stuck under the vram <CHIP>U8550</CHIP>. Tech accidentally pulled pad 152 and 153. These both seem important.

Wondering if it would be possible to move <CHIP>U8550</CHIP> over to <CHIP>U8450</CHIP> OR <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> since there are no vrams soldered there on this board with the 216-0809000 GPU for a fix or is this board trashed now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ripped vram pads
threads.message:
You can still disable dGPU and let it work on iGPU only.
I think is better option than trash it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ripped vram pads
threads.message: Is there a way to modify the board to where I could use just one vram Samsung 256MB at <CHIP>U8500</CHIP> in place of the two hynix 128mb vrams?
